Classical.Structure: Default Mode Network. A large-scale brain network (medial prefrontal cortex, posterior cingulate cortex, etc.).
Classical.Function: Active during wakeful rest. Involved in self-referential thought, autobiographical memory, and future planning.
Classical.Pathology: Hyperactive in depression (rumination); disrupted in Alzheimer's.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: The classical DMN network is the 'shadow' of a deeply entangled quantum information network, evidenced by non-classical proton spin correlations (entanglement witness W > 1) that collapse under anesthesia. [cite: 3694-3708]

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Ego' construct. The narrative generator that weaves memory and perception into a stable 'I-story'.

Falsification_Hypotheses: Advanced MRI protocols (Kerskens, 2024) will fail to find an entanglement witness (W <= 1) in the DMN of conscious subjects. [cite: 3699]
The entanglement signature (W > 1) will persist during deep, non-dreaming sleep or general anesthesia. [cite: 3699, 3704]
Experimental_Protocols: Advanced MRI with Multi-Quantum Coherence (MQC) sequences to calculate the Entanglement Witness (W) in DMN nodes. [cite: 3697-3698]
Correlate the Heartbeat Evoked Potential's (HEP) quantum signature with DMN activity. [cite: 3702-3703]
